 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשַׁל‎</span> 

**verb 1.** intransitive ==slip or drop off==; also transitive: 

**2.** ==draw off==. 

**3.** ==clear away== (Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשַׁל‎</span> probably intransitive, Qal not used, but noun <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְשִׁילָה‎</span> ***a falling off***, etc.; Pi\`el, Hiph\`il ***cast off, let fall off***, Niph\`al ***be cast off, fall off***; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Aph\`el <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַשֵּׁיל‎</span> ***cast out*** (from house); Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***excidit*** pluma, etc.; but also transitive, avis ***mutavit rejecitque*** plumas ([[BDB#Frey|Frey]]); — <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***celeriter extraxit***, etc., is denominative from loan-word according to [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>88</sup>); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנָשַׁל‎</span> consecutive [[Deut.7.1|Deut 7:1]] + 2 t.; ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשַּׁל‎</span> [[Deut.28.40|Deut 28:40]] ***Imperative*** masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׁל‎</span> [[Exod.3.5|Exod 3:5]]; [[Josh.5.15|Josh 5:15]] — 

**1.** ***slip or drop off***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנָשַׁל הַבַּרְזֶל מִןהָֿעֵץ‎</span> [[Deut.19.5|Deut 19:5]] ***and the iron slippeth off from the wood*** (i.e. axe-head from helve); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשַּׁל זֵיתֶ֑ךָ‎</span> [[Deut.28.40|Deut 28:40]] ***thine olives shall drop off*** (absolute). 

**2.** ***draw off*** sandal from (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵעַל‎</span>) foot [[Exod.3.5|Exod 3:5]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Josh.5.15|Josh 5:15]] ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]]). 

**3.** ***clear away*** nations <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִפָּנֶיךָ‎</span> [[Deut.7.1|Deut 7:1]]; [[Deut.7.22|Deut 7:22]]. **Pi\`el** ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְנַשֵּׁל‎</span> [[2Kgs.16.6|2Kgs 16:6]] ***he cleared*** the Jews ***entirely*** out of (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>) Elath.
